item.title: Amit Shah's veiled jibe at Rahul Gandhi: ‘54-year-old yuva roams around with Constitution’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amit Shah's Veiled Jibe at Rahul Gandhi: ‘54-Year-Old Yuva Roams Around with Constitution’

Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Union Home Minister Amit Shah addressed the Rajya Sabha during a debate marking the 75th anniversary of the Indian Constitution, making pointed remarks directed at Rahul Gandhi for his frequent references to the Constitution in speeches.

  • Amit Shah criticized Rahul Gandhi for allegedly carrying 'fake copies' of the Constitution.
  • He highlighted that the constitutional provision for amendments exists within the Constitution itself.
  • Shah referenced past amendments made during both Congress and BJP rule, ensuring to note the number of constitutional changes made by each party.
  • He accused Congress of restricting freedom of expression through early amendments.
“The 54-year-old leader who calls himself 'yuva', keeps roaming around with the Constitution claiming that we would change the Constitution.” - Amit Shah

This discussion reflects ongoing tensions between the BJP and Congress regarding their interpretations of constitutional amendments and political narratives.

item.title: 'Am I a toy?': NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal launches veiled attack on party president Ajit Pawar after excl - The Times of India
item.description:
'Am I a toy?': NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal launches veiled attack on party president Ajit Pawar after exclusion from Cabinet expansion

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Chhagan Bhujbal, a leader from the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), expressed his discontent after not being included in the recent Cabinet expansion. His comments suggest a rift within the party, especially directed at party president Ajit Pawar.

  • Bhujbal's comments reflect internal party tensions.
  • Exclusion from the Cabinet has raised questions about leadership decisions.
  • The phrase 'Am I a toy?' symbolizes feelings of marginalization.
“Am I a toy?”

This incident highlights not only Bhujbal's frustration but also broader issues of communication and dissent within the NCP, potentially impacting its unity moving forward.

item.title: Aviation ministry acts on hoax threat issuers: Rs 1 lakh penalty; denied boarding in place now - The Times of India
item.description:
Aviation Ministry Penalizes Hoax Threat Issuers with Rs 1 Lakh Fine

Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Aviation Ministry has implemented new measures against individuals issuing hoax threats. A penalty of Rs 1 lakh will be imposed, and there will be restrictions on boarding for offenders.

  • Introduction of Rs 1 lakh penalty for hoax threat issuers.
  • Passengers may be denied boarding based on allegations of issuing hoax threats.
  • The new regulation aims to enhance aviation security and discourage false threats.
“The safety of passengers is our utmost priority. Hoax threats derail our operations and put lives at risk.”

This new rule by the Aviation Ministry highlights commitment to improving passenger safety and reducing disruptions caused by hoaxes.

item.title: Parliament Session Live: Constitution crushed arrogance of many dictators, says Amit Shah in Rajya Sabha - India Today
item.description:
Amit Shah Criticizes Congress Amidst Parliament Session Debates

Published on: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: India Today

During the ongoing Parliament Winter Session, Union Home Minister Amit Shah delivered a series of remarks against the Congress party while discussing the Constitution and governance initiatives.

  • The government introduced the One Nation One Election bill aimed at reforming election timings.
  • Amit Shah accused Congress of past misdeeds, including the imposition of Emergency in 1975.
  • Shah highlighted how the NDA government has worked for the rights of Muslim women, citing the abolition of triple talaq.
  • He criticized Rahul Gandhi for allegedly carrying a blank Constitution during debates.
  • Shah stressed the importance of India's economic independence and credited the current government for its achievements.
“Today, we are the fifth largest economy. We have left the UK behind.” - Amit Shah

Shah's statements reflect the current political tensions and highlight ongoing discussions about governance and party accountability within the Parliament.

item.title: Justice Shekhar Yadav Appears Before Supreme Court Collegium To Put Forth Stand Over Comments Made At VHP ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Justice Shekhar Yadav Appears Before Supreme Court Collegium To Put Forth Stand Over Comments Made At VHP

Publication Date: December 17, 2024

Source: Live Law

Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav of the Allahabad High Court appeared today before the Supreme Court Collegium led by CJI Sanjiv Khanna to address his comments made at a VHP event on December 8.

  • Justice Yadav was asked to explain his comments due to widespread criticism for being communal and derogatory towards the Muslim community.
  • The Collegium aims to uphold the principles of natural justice before taking any action against him.
  • A PIL has been filed against Yadav, along with an impeachment motion submitted to the Rajya Sabha by 55 MPs.
“The country would function as per the wishes of the majority,” - Justice Shekhar Yadav

The meeting indicates the Collegium's effort to address potential controversies before further decisions are taken regarding Justice Yadav's position in light of his remarks.

item.title: BJP To Send Notices To MPs Absent For "One Nation, One Election" Bill - NDTV
item.description:
BJP To Send Notices To MPs Absent For 'One Nation, One Election' Bill

Publication Date: December 13, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The BJP has decided to send notices to its MPs who were absent during the introduction of the "One Country One Election Bill" in the Lok Sabha. More than 20 BJP MPs missed the critical session, raising concerns about party support for the bill.

  • The BJP sent a whip instructing MPs to be present during the bill's introduction.
  • Despite the absence, the bills passed with a simple majority: 269 in favor, 198 against.
  • The Congress party criticized the government, claiming the necessary two-thirds majority was not met.
  • Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal emphasized that the bill would not undermine the Constitution.
  • The bill aims to synchronize elections at various levels and requires discussion across all states.
“Undoubtedly the government has larger numbers on its side... but to pass it (bills to amend the Constitution) you need a 2/3 majority that they very clearly don't have.” - Shashi Tharoor, Congress

This development highlights tensions between the ruling party and the opposition regarding electoral reforms and constitutional amendments.

item.title: Chennai Weather: Heavy Rain Likely In Chennai For 2 Days, Orange Alert In 4 TN Districts - News18
item.description:
Chennai Weather: Heavy Rain Likely In Chennai For 2 Days, Orange Alert In 4 TN Districts

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: News18

The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a weather warning for Chennai due to a low-pressure area in the Bay of Bengal. The effects are expected to last for several days.

  • A low-pressure area has formed over the South Bay of Bengal.
  • An orange alert has been issued for very heavy rainfall in several districts.
  • Heavy rain is expected in Chennai and surrounding areas on December 17 and 18.
  • The rain is likely to intensify on December 19 and continue until December 20.
  • Chennai, Chengalpattu, Tiruvallur, and Puducherry are among the districts affected.
"The Meteorological Department warns of very heavy rainfall on Tuesday and expects rainfall to begin around 1 pm, intensifying throughout the day."

This weather condition is significant for the affected areas, with warnings issued to prepare for potential heavy rainfall impacts.

item.title: ‘Congress promoted river water disputes between states’: PM Modi in Rajasthan - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi Criticizes Congress for Water Disputes During Rajasthan Event

Date: Dec 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi accused the Congress party of obstructing farmers' welfare and promoting disputes over river water between states during an event in Rajasthan.

  • Modi addressed the “Ek Varsh-Parinaam Utkarsh” event in Jaipur marking one year of the BJP government in Rajasthan.
  • He claimed the Congress party failed to promote farmers' welfare and cited the delay in the Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project as proof.
  • Modi emphasized the BJP's commitment to promoting dialogue and cooperation between states regarding water issues.
  • He laid the foundation for 24 projects worth over ₹46,400 crore related to energy, roads, railways, and water.
“The Congress never wants to reduce water problems...The water of our rivers used to flow across the borders, but our farmers did not get its benefits.” - PM Modi

PM Modi highlighted the BJP's initiatives and criticized the opposition for not providing solutions to water-related challenges faced by farmers.

item.title: HYDRAA to Demolish Structures Built Without Permission After July - Deccan Chronicle
item.description:
HYDRAA to Demolish Structures Built Without Permission After July

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Hydraa Commissioner AV Ranganath has announced the demolition of unauthorized constructions that began after July 2024 within the FTL limits at Kamunicheruvu, Moosapet, due to local complaints of lake encroachment.

  • Structures built after July 2024 without proper permission will be demolished.
  • Encroachers are warned against dumping construction materials in the lake.
  • Older structures with existing permissions will be respected.
  • Hydraa is committed to protecting lakes and minimizing impact on poorer residents during enforcement actions.
“Hydraa would not touch buildings that were constructed earlier but Hydraa was formed in July and the structures that came up in the limits of FTL and those without permission from departments concerned since July would be demolished,” AV Ranganath stated.

This initiative aims to protect local environments and ensure compliance with construction regulations.

item.title: Actress Pavithra Gowda, prime accused in Renukaswamy murder case walks out of jail - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Actress Pavithra Gowda, prime accused in Renukaswamy murder case walks out of jail

Published Date: 17 December 2024, Source: Bengaluru

Pavithra Gowda, a Kannada actress and the prime accused in the murder case of Renukaswamy, was released on bail from the Parappana Agrahara central prison.

  • Pavithra Gowda received conditional bail from the Karnataka High Court.
  • Other accused include actor Darshan, R Nagaraju, Anu Kumar, Lakshman M, Jagadeesh, and Pradoosh S Rao.
  • The murder case involves an alleged offense related to Renukaswamy, a fan of Darshan, sending obscene messages to Gowda.
  • Renukaswamy's body was discovered near a storm water drain, and post-mortem reports confirmed death due to shock and hemorrhage from multiple injuries.
  • Pavithra is accused of instigating and conspiring with others in the murder.
“Police have said Pavithra was the 'major cause' for Renukaswamy's murder...”

This case has garnered significant media attention due to the involvement of well-known personalities and the public's interest in the details surrounding the murder.

item.title: Disgruntled Chhagan Bhujbal hits out at Ajit Pawar: ‘I am not a toy in anyone’s hand’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Disgruntled Chhagan Bhujbal hits out at Ajit Pawar: ‘I am not a toy in anyone’s hand’

Publication Date: Tuesday, December 12, 2024

Source: Indian Express

Senior NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal expressed his frustration after not being inducted into Maharashtra’s Cabinet, claiming that his opposition to Jarange-Patil led to his exclusion despite the Chief Minister’s support for his inclusion.

  • Bhujbal felt neglected by Ajit Pawar, voicing his concerns publicly.
  • He accused Ajit Pawar of controlling party decisions and hinting that he was excluded as punishment for his stance on Maratha rights.
  • Bhujbal plans to convene supporters in Nashik to discuss his future after feeling disregarded by the party leadership.
  • He expressed dissatisfaction about being treated as a mere pawn in political decisions.
  • Senior NCP leader Praful Patel affirmed Bhujbal's desire to join the Rajya Sabha but there were complications with candidate selections.
“I am not a toy in your hands who will follow blindly everything… Chhagan Bhujbal is not that kind of man.”

In conclusion, Bhujbal's statements highlight internal party conflicts and the challenges within the NCP as leaders navigate their political ambitions amid shifting alliances.

item.title: Several Delhi schools receive bomb threat; fifth incident in nine days - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi Schools Targeted by Bomb Threats: Fifth Incident in Nine Days

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Officials reported bomb threats received by multiple schools in Delhi on December 17, marking the fifth such incident within nine days. The threats have led to increased security measures and the implementation of a hybrid learning schedule.

  • Bomb threats were reported from several schools, including DPS R.K. Puram.
  • A search by local police and bomb detection teams found no suspicious items.
  • Schools in Delhi are operating under a hybrid model due to air quality concerns.
  • Previous threats were received on December 9, 13, and 14, prompting investigations.
“Bomb vests” were mentioned in threatening emails sent to some schools.

The surge in bomb threats has raised security concerns in the capital, prompting investigations by the Delhi Police.

item.title: Mohan Babu's wife addresses family dispute - Deccan Chronicle
item.description:
Mohan Babu's Wife Responds to Family Dispute

Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Nirmala, the wife of actor Mohan Babu, has publicly addressed the ongoing family dispute, defending Manchu Vishnu against allegations made by Manoj.

  • Nirmala clarified that Manoj's allegations against Vishnu are unfounded.
  • She noted that Vishnu visited their home on her birthday with a cake, and there was no disturbance caused by him.
  • Nirmala emphasized that Vishnu has equal rights to the family home.
  • She dismissed the complaint by Manoj as baseless and irrelevant.
Nirmala stated, "Contrary to what was reported, Vishnu did not create any disturbance. He has the same rights to this house as Manoj."

This response sheds light on the ongoing conflict within the Manchu family and highlights the importance of addressing family issues directly.

item.title: One nation, one election bills introduced in Lok Sabha, 269 MPs vote in favour - Hindustan Times
item.description:
One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced in Lok Sabha

Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Lok Sabha witnessed the introduction of bills aimed at holding simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and state assemblies, which garnered substantial support but faced sharp criticism from opposition parties.

  • Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal introduced two constitutional amendment bills for simultaneous elections.
  • A total of 269 MPs voted in favor of the bills while 198 opposed them.
  • The opposition, including Congress, Samajwadi Party, and Trinamool Congress, raised concerns about the constitutionality and potential threats to democratic processes.
  • Opposition MPs argued the bills undermine the Constitution's basic structure and are a step towards 'dictatorship.'
  • The bills propose amendments to hold mid-term elections only for the legislatures affected, delaying simultaneous elections until 2034.
“Introduction, consideration of one nation, one election bills beyond the legislative competence of this House, urge govt to withdraw it,” said Congress MP Manish Tewari.

The proposed changes have sparked widespread debate about their implications for democratic accountability and governance in India.
